intro: Impatiens vagans, commonly known as the wandering impatiens, is a species of flowering plant in the family Balsaminaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of ovate to heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Impatiens vagans prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens.
